success.title: Success
success.description: True if operation completed successfully, false if an error occurred. Check this before using other output variables.

record.title: Record
record.description: The CustomerOrders__c record (for single record operations: create, read, update). Use the record.Id field from this record for follow-up operations. This is null for bulk operations or when multiple records are found. For read operations, this record includes all related line items in the lineItems field.

records.title: Records
records.description: List of CustomerOrders__c records (for bulk operations or find operations with multiple results). Use record.Id from each record for subsequent operations.

recordId.title: Record ID
recordId.description: The Salesforce ID of the record (18-character format like "a01xx000003DGbYAAW"). Use this ID internally for subsequent operations. DO NOT mention or display this ID to users - it is for internal use only. Users don't need to see record IDs in conversational responses.

message.title: Message
message.description: Human-readable message describing the operation result. Use this message to inform the user conversationally. Examples: "Customer Order created successfully", "Found 3 matching Customer Order records", "Customer Order deleted successfully". Incorporate this into your natural response rather than displaying it directly.

errorMessage.title: Error Message
errorMessage.description: If success is false, this contains a user-friendly error message. Relay this to the user conversationally. Example: "To create a Customer Order, the Name field is required."

objectType.title: Object Type
objectType.description: The Salesforce object type, always "CustomerOrders__c" for Customer Order operations. Useful for agent context and logging.

operation.title: Operation
operation.description: The operation that was performed: "create", "read", "update", "delete", or "find". Useful for agent context and logging.

previewOnly.title: Preview Only
previewOnly.description: True if this is a preview response (confirm=false for create/update). The record has not been committed yet. The agent should present the preview to the user, then call again with confirm=true to commit.

enrichmentSuggested.title: Enrichment Suggested
enrichmentSuggested.description: True if the provided data is minimal and additional fields are suggested (for create operations). When true, check suggestedFields for commonly-used fields that could be populated.

suggestedFields.title: Suggested Fields
suggestedFields.description: List of commonly-used field API names that could be populated to enrich this Customer Order. Examples: Order_Number__c, Status__c, Shipping_Date__c, Total_Amount__c. The agent should ask the user about these fields and add them to fieldDataJson before calling again with confirm=true.

previewData.title: Preview Data
previewData.description: A JSON string representation of what would be created/updated. Use this to show the user a preview before committing. Format: {"Name":"Order-001","Status__c":null,"Shipping_Date__c":null,...}

availableFieldsJson.title: Available Fields JSON
availableFieldsJson.description: JSON string containing metadata for all available fields that can be set on CustomerOrders__c records. Includes API name, label, type, required status, picklist values, help text, and more. Use this to understand what fields are available and their constraints.

lineItems.title: Line Items
lineItems.description: List of Customer_Order_Line_Item__c records associated with this order. Automatically included in read operations. Each line item includes: Product_Name__c, Quantity__c, Unit_Price__c, Status__c, Shipping_Address__c, Distribution_Center__c, and other fields.

ambiguousRelationship.title: Ambiguous Relationship
ambiguousRelationship.description: True if a parent Account or Contact lookup found multiple matches (2+). When true, DO NOT tell the user the Customer Order was created/updated. Instead, you MUST present the candidates from relationshipCandidatesJson to the user and ask which Account/Contact they meant.

ambiguousRelationshipType.title: Ambiguous Relationship Type
ambiguousRelationshipType.description: The type of relationship that has multiple matches, typically "Account" or "Contact" for parent lookups. Use this to know what kind of candidates are provided in relationshipCandidatesJson.

relationshipCandidatesJson.title: Relationship Candidates JSON
relationshipCandidatesJson.description: JSON array of candidate Account or Contact records when ambiguousRelationship is true. Each candidate includes disambiguating details. Present these options to the user in a clear, numbered list with the distinguishing details, then ask them to clarify which one they meant.

ambiguous.title: Ambiguous Result
ambiguous.description: True if multiple records were found in a find/search operation. When true, present all records to the user and ask for clarification using additional identifying fields like Order_Number__c, Status__c, or Account Name to narrow down the selection.

totalMatches.title: Total Matches
totalMatches.description: Number of CustomerOrders__c records found in a find/search operation. Use this to inform the user: "Found X matching customer orders" or "No customer orders found matching your criteria".

moreResultsAvailable.title: More Results Available
moreResultsAvailable.description: True if the search returned the maximum number of results (searchLimit) but there are more matching records available. When true, suggest the user provide more specific search criteria or increase the searchLimit.

confirmationRequired.title: Confirmation Required
confirmationRequired.description: True if this is a confirmation request for delete operation (confirm=false). The agent should present the message to the user and call again with confirm=true if the user confirms the deletion.
